title: Trump Deletes Racist Video Portraying the Obamas as Apes
summary: The White House press secretary had dismissed criticism of the clip’s racist content as “fake outrage.” But later Friday, the clip disappeared from the president’s social media feed.

title: Trump Administration Social Media Posts Echo White Supremacist Messaging
summary: A flurry of posts from the White House, Department of Labor and Department of Homeland Security have included images, slogans and even a song used by the white nationalist right.

title: ‘They Couldn’t Break Me’: A Protester, the White House and a Doctored Photo
summary: President Trump and the White House regularly circulate imagery that has been manipulated by A.I. But the photo of Nekima Levy Armstrong was different.

title: Nike and Trump’s Supporters Have Been on a Collision Course for Years
summary: The chair of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission has long opposed diversity initiatives like those that Nike embraced.

title: Federal Vaccine Advisers Take Aim at Covid Shots
summary: One panelist accused the F.D.A. of withholding data on potential harms. The advisers also are reviewing research on vaccines given to pregnant women.

title: Latest U.S. Boat Strike Kills 2 in Pacific
summary: The operation was authorized by the Marine general who took command of military operations in Latin America and the Caribbean earlier in the day.

title: Smithsonian Folklife Festival Gives Way to Trump’s Patriotic Fair
summary: The summer festival, held annually since 1967, will not take place as usual on the National Mall, which will instead host the president’s Great American State Fair.

title: As Olympics Open, Pope Leo Warns Against Using Sports for ‘Propaganda or National Supremacy’
summary: The Milan-Cortina Games are overlapping with a moment of geopolitical turbulence as conflicts rage, national leaders issue threats and alliances are strained.

title: Milan Winter Olympics Opening Ceremony: What Time to Watch, How to Watch, and More
summary: They will take place at 2 p.m. Eastern on Friday across four separate venues in Northern Italy.

title: Iran Is at Work on Missile and Nuclear Sites, Satellite Images Show
summary: Repairs at key missile sites began soon after they were hit by Israeli and U.S. strikes last year, but work at Iran’s nuclear facilities has been slower.

title: U.S. and Iran Set for Talks in Oman
summary: Abbas Araghchi, the minister, said the two sides had agreed to continue negotiations at a later date. The U.S. delegation had yet to comment.

title: My Dog Tintin’s Trans-Atlantic Voyage on the Queen Mary 2
summary: How would a 10-year-old terrier mutt, averse to flying, fare during eight days at sea?

title: U.S. Seeks to Expedite Deportation of 5-Year-Old Liam Conejo Ramos
summary: Liam was detained last month in Minneapolis during an immigration enforcement operation in which his father was also detained by federal agents.

title: How the Black Panthers’ Playbook Helped Minneapolis Activists Fight Trump
summary: The monitoring of federal agents by activists has been at the heart of the opposition to the Trump administration’s raids. The tactic has a long history.

title: As Minnesota Reels Amid Immigration Crackdown, a Sheriff Agonizes Over Her Role
summary: Sheriff Dawanna Witt of Hennepin County says she thinks she could help end the crackdown by allowing some measure of cooperation with ICE. She also knows that could cost her re-election.

title: ‘Gang Stuff’ and ‘Illicit Trysts’: How Epstein Sought Leverage With the Wealthy
summary: Jeffrey Epstein drafted letters to men like the retail billionaire Leslie Wexner in which he hinted at shared secrets.

title: The Fight Between a Watch Heiress and an Art Museum on the French Riviera
summary: An eccentric watch heiress wants to revoke her grandfather’s donation of Jean Cocteau artworks after the museum built to display them was overwhelmed by a freakish storm.

title: A Pro-Israel Group’s Move Backfires as Gaza Tensions Flare in Midterms
summary: A surprising twist in a New Jersey primary race showed how questions about Israel continue to roil American politics in unpredictable ways.

title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Steps Onto a Wider Stage
summary: The progressive lawmaker is taking a larger role in Democratic politics, supporting moderate candidates and helping drive the party’s economic message. Now she is planning a major trip abroad.

title: New Jersey House Primary Remains Too Close to Call
summary: Two Democrats, Analilia Mejia and Tom Malinowski, were leading in a race for their party’s nomination to replace Gov. Mikie Sherrill in the House.

title: Fear of AI Replacing Software Makers Hits Stocks. Here’s What to Know.
summary: The prospect of disruptions from artificial intelligence has hung over the economy for years. But this week advances in software tools precipitated a sell-off on Wall Street.

title: It’s Time to Rethink the Standard Investment Advice. But Not Too Much.
summary: With signs of trouble popping up in financial markets, investors need to decide whether they can ignore the turmoil, our columnist says.

title: Libyan Man Is Arrested in Deaths of 4 Americans in 2012 Benghazi Attack
summary: The man, Zubayar al-Bakoush, is the third suspect apprehended for the 2012 attack on U.S. facilities that killed four Americans.

title: Savannah Guthrie’s Brother Renews Plea for Return of Their Missing Mother, Nancy
summary: The search for Nancy Guthrie has entered its sixth day. The F.B.I. has offered a $50,000 reward for information.

title: Trump’s Immigration Policy Is 100 Years Old
summary: The White House seems to be mining the Coolidge era for inspiration. But America is not the country it was in 1924.

title: Russian General Is Shot in Latest Attack on a Top Military Leader in Moscow
summary: Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alekseyev provided intelligence to the Kremlin for Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and had been penalized by the U.S. twice, including for meddling in elections.

title: Bad Bunny’s All-American, All-Spanish, All-Eyes-on-Him Super Bowl
summary: Amid harsh rhetoric from the White House, the Puerto Rican superstar will take the stage on Sunday promising a message of unity: “The world will dance.”

title: The 2026 Super Bowl Ads (So Far), Ranked
summary: Here is our critic’s survey of this year’s Super Bowl commercials, from best to worst to A.I.

title: These New Englanders Won’t be Rooting for the Patriots in the Super Bowl
summary: When the New England Patriots play in the Super Bowl, a collective sigh will rise from the willful few who live in the region but root for other teams.

title: The Finance Industry Is a Grift. Let’s Start Treating It That Way.
summary: Regulating the industry is useful. Shaming it is crucial.

title: America’s Game
summary: We tell you everything you need to know about this year’s Super Bowl.

title: Mangione State Trial Will Start in June, Manhattan Judge Says
summary: The decision on Friday illuminated the intensifying race between state and federal prosecutors to be the first to try Luigi Mangione. His lawyers said their client was stuck in a “tug of war.”

title: Harvard Proposes Capping As at 20 Percent to Curb Grade Inflation
summary: A recent report found that a majority of grades given out at Harvard were A’s. Professors will vote on a proposal to limit the number to around 20 percent.

title: Timothy Busfield Is Indicted on Charges of Child Sexual Abuse
summary: A grand jury in New Mexico heard allegations that Mr. Busfield, the actor and director, had sexual contact with a child actor. He has denied the charges.

title: Sonny Jurgensen, One of N.F.L.’s Greatest Passers, Dies at 91
summary: The Hall of Fame quarterback threw 255 touchdown passes with the Philadelphia Eagles and Washington Redskins.
